meanings.definition: Of extremely poor or unreliable quality.
meanings.sent1: The janky old car barely made it up the hill.
meanings.sent2: The janky phone kept dropping calls.
meanings.sent3: I tried to use the janky toaster, but it just made burnt bread.
meanings.sent4: Her janky umbrella was no match for the heavy rain.
meanings.sent5: The janky bridge swayed in the wind, making everyone nervous.

meanings.definition: In a state of disrepair or dysfunction.
meanings.sent1: The janky door wouldn't close properly.
meanings.sent2: The janky computer froze every few minutes.
meanings.sent3: We laughed at the janky bike with a wobbly wheel.
meanings.sent4: His janky watch always showed the wrong time.
meanings.sent5: The janky faucet leaked constantly, causing a mess.

meanings.definition: To make something unreliable or of poor quality.
meanings.sent1: He managed to janky up the whole project with his careless mistakes.
meanings.sent2: She accidentally jankied the new painting by spilling paint on it.
meanings.sent3: The kids decided to janky their fort by using flimsy materials.
meanings.sent4: The storm jankied the power lines, causing a blackout.
meanings.sent5: The chef didn't mean to janky the dish, but he added too much salt.
